sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph G shown below. Identify the cut vertices and bridges in the graph G. 

![Graph image](https://i.imgur.com/4Cvjt0E.png)
message_2:
To identify the cut vertices and bridges in the graph G, we first need to understand their definitions:

- A cut vertex (also known as an articulation point) is a vertex whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph.
- A bridge is an edge whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph.

Now, let's analyze the given graph:

![Graph image](https://i.imgur.com/4Cvjt0E.png)

Cut vertices:
1. Vertex A: If we remove vertex A, the graph will be split into two connected components: {B, C, D, E} and {F, G, H}.
2. Vertex E: If we remove vertex E, the graph will be split into two connected components: {A, B, C, D} and {F, G, H}.

Bridges:
1. Edge (A, E): If we remove edge (A, E), the graph will be split into two connected components: {A, F, G, H} and {B, C, D, E}.
2. Edge (D, E): If we remove edge (D, E), the graph will be split into two connected components: {A, B, C, D} and {E, F, G, H}.

So, the cut vertices in the graph G are A and E, and the bridges are edges (A, E) and (D, E).
